instructions: On your Android device, launch your Contacts app, tap on the menu button, and navigate to Settings . Find the Import/Export setting and tap it. The following images show the steps on a Samsung device running Android Oreo. Your screens may look a little different, depending on the device you own, but the basic steps should be roughly the same. Tap the Export button. Then choose to export to the SIM card . Wait for the contacts to be exported to your SIM card. When the export is complete, remove the SIM card from your Android phone and insert it into your iPhone. On the iPhone, tap the Settings app to open it. Tap Contacts (on some older versions of the iOS, this is Mail, Contacts, Calendars ). Tap Import SIM Contacts.

On your Android device, back up your contacts to Google. The backup should happen automatically if you use your Google account on your device. You can also tap Settings , Account , the Google account you want to sync to, and then toggle Sync Contacts to ON. With that done, add your Google account to your iPhone. When the account is set up, you may be able to enable contact syncing right away. If not, go to Settings > Passwords & Accounts and tap the Gmail account. Move the Contacts slider to the On (green) position, and the contacts you added to your Google account will sync to the iPhone.
